intro: Monochasma savatieri, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–30 cm and prefers bright, indirect light. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, pink, and white, and it is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. The plant has a relatively short flowering period, usually lasting several weeks.
